Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw at least two different types of habitats, such as land and water habitats.
The student can include different kinds of living things in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, or fish.
The student can show a variety of plants in each habitat, making observations from firsthand experience or media.
The student can illustrate different types of animals in each habitat, based on observations.
The student can make comparisons by showing how the types of living things differ between the habitats drawn.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly show the differences in biodiversity between the habitats.
The student can identify patterns of diversity in the plants and animals illustrated in the different habitats.
